pullRequest.body:
Also

- replace some proofs by `fun_prop`
- use `Prod.map` instead of an inline lambda in some lemmas
- fix `to_additive` name for `ContinuousAddMonoidHom.prod` and `ContinuousAddMonoidHom.prodMap`
  (were `sum` and `sum_map`).



---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by grunweg.
This PR was included in a batch that was canceled, it will be automatically retried

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11221224156/job/31191103205)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11221224156/job/31191103575)

This rename is definitely useful, by rule 5 of the naming convention, thanks for doing so!
(The conventions don't speak about lowerCamelCase names spanning namespaces, such as `Prod.map` becoming `prodMap`, but this makes sense. Would you like to propose a clarification to the rules? Is there precedent for this already? If not, can you leave a brief notice on zulip, please?)

Using Prod.map is a good clarification, thanks. I also approve of the golfs.
maintainer merge

Oh, and: please add the missing docstring, to appease the docBlame linter.

This rename is definitely useful, by rule 5 of the naming convention, thanks for doing so!
(The conventions don't speak about lowerCamelCase names spanning namespaces, such as `Prod.map` becoming `prodMap`, but this makes sense. Would you like to propose a clarification to the rules? Is there precedent for this already? If not, can you leave a brief notice on zulip, please?)

Using Prod.map is a good clarification, thanks. I also approve of the golfs.
maintainer merge

Oh, and: please add the missing docstring, to appease the docBlame linter.
Where does this change come from?
I'm using `Prod.map` instead of an inline lambda in some lemma, so it appears in the proof state. `simp` would simplify it but `simp only` needs an extra hint.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore(Topology): rename some `prod_map`/`prod` to `prodMap`

This rename is definitely useful, by rule 5 of the naming convention, thanks for doing so!
(The conventions don't speak about lowerCamelCase names spanning namespaces, such as `Prod.map` becoming `prodMap`, but this makes sense. Would you like to propose a clarification to the rules? Is there precedent for this already? If not, can you leave a brief notice on zulip, please?)

Using Prod.map is a good clarification, thanks. I also approve of the golfs.
